meanings.definition: Having or involving three optical systems or lenses.
meanings.sent1: The trinocular microscope allowed us to see the tiny details clearly.
meanings.sent2: The trinocular camera captured the panoramic view with precision.
meanings.sent3: The trinocular binoculars made bird watching with friends more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her trinocular vision of the problem helped her find a unique solution.
meanings.sent5: The trinocular glasses gave him a new perspective on the world.

meanings.definition: A device with three eyepieces for viewing an object.
meanings.sent1: The trinocular at the observatory allowed multiple people to view the stars at once.
meanings.sent2: The trinocular in the lab helped the scientists observe the specimen together.
meanings.sent3: The trinocular in the classroom made it easier for students to share the view.
meanings.sent4: The trinocular on the ship was essential for spotting distant land.
meanings.sent5: The trinocular on the tour bus provided a clear sight of the landmarks.
